page.title: 09HISTORY IN HALLATON TODAY 3
page.content: There are fine 18th century residences in the village - for example Hallaton Hall, now Torch House, built in 1713. In 1843 Hallaton Manor was moved stone by stone from its position by the Grange to the top of the hill outside the village. It is now an old people's home with 30 residents and 20 staff. In the High Street and Churchgate are two pumps used by the villagers until 25 years ago. Behind the Cross is a water conduit which diverted water to large houses. One cottage in Hog Lane now houses the Hallaton Museum, which contains many local treasures and items of interest. It was opened in 1979 with support from a number of villagers, most notably Mrs H Bewicke Whigham. It now has 260 exhibits and opens on Sunday afternoons in Summer.
